title: 1955 Ford Thunderbird

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Houston is proud to offer this beautiful, numbers matching, blue 1957 Ford Thunderbird! After 60 years this car has only covered 80,414 miles. A number better suited to a 5 year old car. The 1957 Thunderbird is part of the first generation of the car which was produced between 1955 and 1957. It was FordÃ¢??s direct response to the Corvette and underwent a rapid development process so it could ultimately be unveiled to the public at the Detroit Auto Show in February of 1954. Production began in September of 1954 for 1955 model years to be sold in October. The Thunderbird was revised for 1957 with a reshaped front bumper, a larger grille and tailfins, and larger tail lamps. The instrument panel was heavily re-styled with round gauges in a single pod, and the rear of the car was lengthened, allowing the spare tire to be positioned back in the trunk. The 312 cu in V8 became the Thunderbird's standard engine, and now produced 245 horsepower. The shape of this car is undeniably 50Ã¢??s and probably one of the most beautiful cars of itÃ¢??s time. This was a time when Elvis Presley was releasing incredible and timeless classics on the radio and movies like 12 Angry Men were making their first appearance in the box office. Ford made this car to be well equipped and it certainly was. This one has air conditioning for those hot summer days, AM radio to keep you entertained and a manual convertible top to get you that little bit closer to the elements. You will find the drive incredibly easy with the cars power brakes and steering, seat belts, tilt wheel and beautiful blue interior. This is a stunning example of an iconic American classic car and itÃ¢??s something that shouldnÃ¢??t be missed. Call the Houston showroom at (832) 243-6220 for more information on this vehicle. If you are viewing this on a 3rd party website then you will be able to find more pictures and an HD video by visiting www.gatewayclassiccars.com. Our showroom is open to the public and you can visit us 9-5 Mon-Sat at 71 Esplanade Blvd Suite 100, Houston, TX 77060.

description: 1955 Ford ThunderbirdThis very nice 1955 T-Bird is in really good condition and is a driver. It has belonged to the same owner since 1976. The car had been in storage since 1996. We have done all the things needed to bring a car like this back to life: New brake lines, new master cylinder, new gas tank, all fuel lines cleaned or replaced. The paint is driver quality and the interior is clean. No cracks in the dash, carpets are good. It has the original 292 ci V8 with 3 speed overdrive transmission and runs and drives like a 1955 T-Bird should. The tires are new and all the hubcaps are there and in excellent condition. The car does have both tops, soft top and removable hardtop. The soft top looks to be OK, but we did not remove the hardtop in order to keep the seal intact.This is a car you will be proud to drive and show at all the local cruise ins and car shows.Please contact:Bill Hanstrom for more details are any questions. 214 683 2811 or email bill.hanstrom@texasmotortoys.com
title: 1955 Ford Thunderbird

description: For sale in our Dallas showroom is a stunning 1961 Ford Thunderbird. The 1961 Thunderbird changed a lot of things for Ford. The 1961 Ford Thunderbird carried a lot of firsts for the car world. It featured new and much sleeker styling than the second-generation models. The engine, a powerful 390 CID V8 breathing through Cherry Bomb glass packs, keeps this beauty moving in all RPMÃ¢??s without drama or much effort. A little history of the Thunderbird was it was 1961's Indianapolis 500 pace car, and featured prominently in US President John F. Kennedy's inaugural parade.The most distinctive feature of the 1961 to 1963 Thunderbirds was the highly touted 'Swing Away' steering wheel. Other innovations include a floating rear view mirror. Common on all autos produced today, this feature was first found on 1961 Thunderbirds. The 1961-63 Thunderbirds styling is unmistakable and brought to life concept styling. Aerodynamic features like the integrated door handles help this car stand out from the crowd were great, but the standout element has to be the Ã¢??rocket boosterÃ¢?Â tail lights. How this hasnÃ¢??t worked its way into more vehicles over the years just baffles us, as it is one of the coolest tail light designs of all time. This car has plenty of features like power windows, power seats, and Air Conditioning. This is a cruiser that is ready to go and be in its new home. The features include AC, AM radio, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Power Windows, Vinyl Interior, Hub Caps, and White Wall Radial Tires. For more HD pictures and video visit http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/carlist2?src=2&location=DFW&desc=Dallas. For more information call our Dallas showroom at 817-310-9400.

description: This 1956 Ford Thunderbird 2 Door Removable Hardtop (

mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Show-Stopping 1956 Ford Thunderbird Removable Hardtop

New to our Pleasanton showroom is this simply awesome 1956 Ford Thunderbird 2 Door Removable Hardtop with white exterior paint, a white removable hardtop and a beautiful tan leather interior.  It features the numbers-matching 312 cid V-8 engine under the hood and automatic transmission, both of which have been restored within the last 1,000 miles.  It is also nicely equipped with power steering, power seats/windows, Vintage Air, and too many other high end upgrades to fully list.
Two Lifetime Owners & Always Stored Indoors

The current owner of this 1956 Ford Thunderbird Removable Hardtop has enjoyed it since 1990 and he has tastefully added air conditioning, power seats, power windows and power steering over the years.  It has been with two lifetime owners throughout its life and according to the current owner, it has always remained garaged and properly serviced.  The overall condition is outstanding with only the slightest signs of visible wear inside and out.

In terms of performance, this 1956 Ford Thunderbird performs like a much newer classic thanks to the excellent maintenance of this vehicle.  The acceleration, shifting, torque and handling are exceptional.  With extensive documentation and a pristine overall condition, this example should attract lots of attention at local shows and have a solid chance of taking home that Best in Class trophy.  You must see it in person to truly appreciate the outstanding quality.
One of the Nicest Examples You’ll Find Anywhere at this Price

Overall, this 1956 Ford Thunderbird Removable Hardtop is one of the cleanest, most original examples you’ll find anywhere at this price point.  This one is immaculate from top to bottom and the performance speaks for itself, so do yourself a favor and come test drive it before it’s gone for good.  For more information about this impressive vehicle, visit our Pleasanton, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
).  Be sure to mention
Stock # P10366
as well.

title: 1957 Ford Thunderbird

description: Ford was looking for something to compete with the Chevrolet Corvette which started to show quickly as a popular segment but didn't want to pursue the sports car necessary but created a segment all of its own. With the clever marketing plan in place, Ford began the production of the Ford Thunderbird in 1955 as a Personal Car segment and although it was very much sporty two-seater convertible just like the Corvette, it paid more attention to luxury and comfort more so than the competition. This model did not inherit its second row of seats until 1958 and from there it slowly but surely grew in size, generation after generation until 1977 when the larger cars lost their popularity in the market. The Thunderbird was one of the longest lasting nametags for Ford and started strong by selling 23 models for every one Corvette sold when it first hit the market. The only changes completed between its inception model to the 1956 was moving the spare tire to a continental-style rear bumper in order to make more room within the trunk.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1955 Ford Thunderbird for consideration. This vehicle is coming to you in a custom white and silver exterior paint job (urethane) and is paired to a red and white vinyl interior that is done up just right. Some key features on this Thunderbird include; rebuilt 292ci engine, 2 speed automatic transmission, dropped spindles, lowering blocks (3” front, 2” rear), power disc / drum brakes, power rack & pinion steering, dual exhaust, Goodyear tires, 18” Coys wheels, tube grille, louvered rear panel, narrowed/tucked bumpers, narrowed 50 Chev rear license frame, newer convertible top and frame, matching hard top with new seals, leather covered steering wheel, 12 volt wiring, newer battery, new gas gauge and sender 12 volt. From behind the wheel this vehicle starts and drives great and with its removable hard top in excellent condition, this is the best of both worlds. Call or email us today for more information on this very unique 1955 Ford Thunderbird.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

description: Special Discount Pricing .  Save 10% on purchase until July 16, 2017.

For those seeking a lovely driver from the Tri-Five Ford Series of Thunderbird's you may have struck  gold.  This sleek and great looking 1957 Ford Thunderbird is gleaming in an above average driver quality Starmist Blue paint with an accenting white interior.   It is powered by a great running and peppy 312/245HP engine twisting into a smooth shifting 3-Speed Ford-O-Matic transmission.  Options include an after market air conditioning, (Thunderbird had no A/C options in the day), power windows and the rare factory option  Dial-O-Matic power seats and rides along on new tires.  It does NOT have its original radio.  As the pictures will attest the car has a great look and stance with all bright work holding a nice shine, paint that suits it well and an immaculate interior.  All gauges and accessories operating as designed.  There are a few small blemishes in the paint but only where seams meet but are not a result of rust.  Beneath the car is well maintained  with no visible indications of rust or a hit.  The current owner has had it for approximately three years and is wishing to sell only out of a need for space.  It comes with hard top and tonneau cover only.  No documentation comes with the car therefore it cannot be claimed to have a numbers matching power-train.  The car is located in Villa Rica, GA some 25 miles west of Atlanta just off I-20.  The owner seeks the fair price of $43.5K but will consider other reasonable close offers.  No trades are sought or considered.   Seller willing to ship worldwide at buyers expense.

title: 1963 Ford Thunderbird

description: This is a Concourse award winning 1957 Ford Thunderbird in Colonial White that comes with two tops, the famous porthole top and the convertible top that is stashed behind the seats. The 1957 model would be the third and final year for the original two passenger Thunderbird, and some feel the third year was the best one yet. It is powered by a matching numbers D code 312 V8 with a 4bbl carburetor and 2-speed Ford-O-Matic transmission.  The carburetor is new, but the original carburetor will be included with the car.  The high quality frame off restoration was completed in 2007.  All parts meet the correct 1957 specs that include a new wiring harness, new suspension parts, new brakes and lines and new exhaust.   Everything under the hood is original and correct, including the 2 year old battery that is correct for the period.  This car has been with the same owner since 1986 and the car has been meticulously cared for and only driven about 3,000 miles since then.  It has a show quality shine and the bumpers were re-chromed to the highest level of quality and the body is straight and very clean. The car was painted with a basecoat and clear coat using high quality RM Paint.  The options included power steering, power brakes and power windows.  The installed radio is not correct, but the original Town and Country radio that came with the car will be included and this car even has the optional trunk mounted antennae.  All gauges in the dash are fully operational and yes, even the clock works as well.  Seat belts were added and the rear taillights with the reverse white light are added for safety.   The interior is in excellent condition. The seats are new with a firm feel, the carpet is clean, the door panels are excellent as well.   It runs and handles very well.  This has to be one of the nicest T-Birds out there.   Please contact Savannah Classic Cars at 912-235-2347.  We can arrange shipping.
title: 1957 Ford Thunderbird
